javinator9889.localemanager.localemanager

Class LocaleManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • javinator9889.localemanager.localemanager.LocaleManager

  • public class LocaleManager
extends Object
    LocaleManager provides an easy access functionality for changing application language to user's preferred one.

    By default, it uses the "default preferences" for ensuring persistence across application sessions and instances, but it also allows the developer to use custom ones, for example for simplifying and merging all shared preferences files.

    It uses proper Android context and configurations for managing and changing locales. As this is not recommended and is not officially maintained and documented by Android, it is possible to alter the locale for a custom application without so much effort with this lib. But it is important that when building your application, advising the user that he should not change the application language but the Android device language instead.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private android.content.SharedPreferences mPreferences
      For data persistence across instances, the user language is stored inside the shared preferences.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocaleManager(android.content.Context context)
      Constructor that takes a Context for obtaining the default shared preferences for storing user data - for using custom shared preferences instead, switch to LocaleManager(SharedPreferences)
      LocaleManager(android.content.SharedPreferences customSharedPreferences)
      Custom constructor that takes a SharedPreferences customized by the user, instead of using the default one.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getLanguage()
      Obtains the user custom language - if this value is not set, a default value is returned (LanguagesSupport.Language.SYSTEM value).
      private void persistLanguage(String language)
      Saves the user language inside the shared preferences - as we care about this value to be saved, we use "commit" instead of apply, just because sometimes the application may be killed which prevents apply() to finish.
      android.content.Context setLocale(android.content.Context context)
      Whenever the app restarts or an activity is created, this method ensures that the user defined custom language is being used instead of Android default's one.
      android.content.Context setNewLocale(android.content.Context context, String language)
      Sets a new locale language that will be used for changing the in-app lang.
      android.content.Context setNewLocaleCustomLanguage(android.content.Context context, String language)
      Sets a new locale language that will be used for changing the in-app lang.
      private android.content.Context updateLocaleResources(android.content.Context context, String language)
      Tries to update the resources by setting a custom locale so the display language will change once the activities are reloaded.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • mPreferences

        private final android.content.SharedPreferences mPreferences
        For data persistence across instances, the user language is stored inside the shared preferences.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocaleManager

        public LocaleManager(@NonNull
                     android.content.Context context)
        Constructor that takes a Context for obtaining the default shared preferences for storing user data - for using custom shared preferences instead, switch to LocaleManager(SharedPreferences)
        Parameters:
        context - base context or activity one for taking the SharedPreferences from.
        See Also:
        PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(Context), LocaleManager(SharedPreferences)

      • LocaleManager

        public LocaleManager(@NonNull
                     android.content.SharedPreferences customSharedPreferences)
        Custom constructor that takes a SharedPreferences customized by the user, instead of using the default one.

        You can switch to LocaleManager(Context) for generating a new instance based on the default shared preferences.

        Parameters:
        customSharedPreferences - custom implementation and/or file for shared preferences.
        See Also:
        LocaleManager(Context)

    • Method Detail

      • getLanguage

        public String getLanguage()
        Obtains the user custom language - if this value is not set, a default value is returned (LanguagesSupport.Language.SYSTEM value).
        Returns:
        String with the user language.
        See Also:
        LanguagesSupport.Language.SYSTEM

      • setLocale

        public android.content.Context setLocale(android.content.Context context)
        Whenever the app restarts or an activity is created, this method ensures that the user defined custom language is being used instead of Android default's one.
        Parameters:
        context - the context from which the locale will be applied.
        Returns:
        context modified with the new locale.

      • setNewLocale

        @NonNull
public android.content.Context setNewLocale(@NonNull
                                                     android.content.Context context,
                                                     @NonNull
                                                     String language)
        Sets a new locale language that will be used for changing the in-app lang. If it success, a call to the method Application.onConfigurationChanged(Configuration) is done.
        Parameters:
        context - the context from which the new locale will be changed.
        language - the new language that will have the application.
        Returns:
        context modified if version is higher than Android N.

      • setNewLocaleCustomLanguage

        @NonNull
public android.content.Context setNewLocaleCustomLanguage(@NonNull
                                                                   android.content.Context context,
                                                                   @NonNull
                                                                   String language)
        Sets a new locale language that will be used for changing the in-app lang. If it success, a call to the method Application.onConfigurationChanged(Configuration) is done.
        Parameters:
        context - the context from which the new locale will be changed.
        language - the new language that will have the application - it can be a custom one if not available at languages.
        Returns:
        context modified if version is higher than Android N.

      • updateLocaleResources

        @NonNull
private android.content.Context updateLocaleResources(@NonNull
                                                               android.content.Context context,
                                                               @NonNull
                                                               String language)
        Tries to update the resources by setting a custom locale so the display language will change once the activities are reloaded.
        Parameters:
        context - the context from which the new locale will be changed.
        language - the new language that will have the application - it can be a custom language if not available at languages.
        Returns:
        context modified with the new locale.

      • persistLanguage

        private void persistLanguage(@NonNull
                             String language)
        Saves the user language inside the shared preferences - as we care about this value to be saved, we use "commit" instead of apply, just because sometimes the application may be killed which prevents apply() to finish.
        Parameters:
        language - the user custom language.
        See Also:
        SharedPreferences.Editor#apply(), SharedPreferences.Editor#commit()
